forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Showers and thunderstorms likely before 2pm, then rain likely between 2pm and 5pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 56. West wind 15 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 46. Northwest wind 10 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the weather today brings a mixture of calamitous beauty and subdued charm. The sky, adorned with a tapestry of clouds, hints at possible showers and thunderstorms, anticipated to cascade down before two o'clock. As the temperatures hover around a cool 56, the brisk west wind brushes against your cheeks, occasionally increasing the sensation of chill with gusts that flirt with 29 mph. While the chance of rain lingers at 40%, the day will gradually transition into a partly sunny interlude, casting soft light on the damp streets. There’s a hint of fog in the distance, framing the Golden Gate Bridge, while the marine layer curls around the bay, providing an ethereal backdrop to an otherwise crisp day.

As dusk draws near, expect the clouds to part somewhat, offering glimpses of the fading sunlight through the tangle of gray. The evening promises clarity, settling to a comfortable 46 degrees, inviting you to venture out in layers. A light jacket, perhaps with a scarf, will keep you snug against the cooling breeze. Consider a casual stroll along one of the quieter piers, where the scent of the ocean mingles with the whispers of the city, or perhaps indulge in a cozy café, warmed by the chatter of evening patrons. While the skies may remain turbulent, there’s a certain tranquility in the air, perfect for finding moments of reflection amidst the vibrant pulse of urban life.
